oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Winding and Unwinding and Essential Intersections in $\mathbb{H}^3$
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gilman, Jane
Keen, Linda
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Group Theory
Mathematics - Geometric Topology
30F40, 20F10, 51xx
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Let $G = \langle A,B \rangle$ be a non-elementary two generator subgroup of the isometry group of $\mathbb{H}^2$, the hyperbolic plane. If $G$ is discrete and free and geometrically finite, its quotient is a pair of pants and in prior work we produced a formula for the number of essential self intersections (ESIs) of any primitive geodesic on the quotient. An ESI is a point where the geodesic has a self-intersection on a seam. Self-intersections of geodesics on arbitrary hyperbolic surfaces have recently been studied by Basmajian and Chas. Here we extend our results to two generator subgroups $G$ of isometries of $\mathbb{H}^3$, hyperbolic three-space, which are discrete, free and geometrically finite. We generalize our definition of ESIs and give a geometric interpretation of them in the quotient manifold. We show that they satisfy the same formulas.
